2-ntomo-mask.name: Nâ€™tomo Mask
2-ntomo-mask.fact: Alpacas are kept in herds that graze on the level heights of the Andes at an altitude of 3,500 to 5,000 metres above sea level.

7-naga-hat.name: Naga Hat
7-naga-hat.fact: It is well adapted to living in cold environments, and is best known for its thick, warm fur that is also used as camouflage.

9-naga-axe.name: Naga Axe
9-naga-axe.fact: It is the most widely distributed species of owl in the world and one of the most widespread of all species of birds.

11-devil-fish-bag.name: Devilfish Bag / Octopus shot
11-devil-fish-bag.fact: Its range has increased alongside human expansion, having been introduced to Australia, where it is considered harmful to native mammals and bird populations

17-spirit-mask.name: NW America Mask
17-spirit-mask.fact: Huskies have continued to be used in sled-dog racing and as a means of essential transportation in rural communities.

artemis-statue.name: Artemis Statue
artemis-statue.fact: Like all lemurs, it is native to Madagascar. It occurs only in the rainforests of Masoala, in the northeast of the island.

janus-headdress.name: Janus Headdress
janus-headdress.fact: Performing rituals whilst wearing headdresses like this is believed to connect people with the spirits of their ancestors.

leopard-1080.name: Leopard Head
leopard-1080.fact: Due to their adaptability, racoons have extended their range to urban areas, where some homeowners consider them to be pests.
